title: Symmetrizing polytopes and posets
abstract:
Motivated by the authors' work on permuto-associahedra, which can be
considered as a symmetrization of the associahedron using the symmetric group,
we introduce and study the $\mathfrak{G}$-symmetrization of an arbitrary
polytope $P$ for any reflection group $\mathfrak{G}$. We show that the
combinatorics, and moreover, the normal fan of such a symmetrization can be
recovered from its refined fundamental fan, a decorated poset describing how
the normal fan of $P$ subdivides the fundamental chamber associated to the
reflection group $\mathfrak{G}$.
  One important application of our results is providing a way to approach the
realization problem of a $\mathfrak{G}$-symmetric poset F, that is, the problem
of constructing a polytope whose face poset is F. Instead of working with the
original poset F, we look at its dual poset T (which is
$\mathfrak{G}$-symmetric as well) and focus on a generating subposet Z of T,
and reduce the problem to realizing Z as a refined fundamental fan.
